Event.0: American playwright and actor Sam Shepard—whose plays adroitly blend images of the American West, Pop motifs, science fiction, and other elements of popular and youth culture—died at age 73.
Event.1: British-born American entertainer and comic actor Bob Hope, who was known for his rapid-fire delivery of jokes and one-liners, died in California.
Event.2: Tony Hawk is the first skateboarder to land a "900"
Event.3:
Terrorist attack at Atlanta Olympics
On this day in 1996 a pipe bomb exploded in Olympic Centennial Park in Atlanta, Georgia, killing 1 person and injuring 111 in the first terrorist attack at the Olympics since the 1972 Games in Munich, West Germany.
Event.4:
Jordan Spieth
American golfer
was born
Event.5: Alan Menken and Howard Ashman's musical "Little Shop of Horrors" opens Off-Broadway at the Orpheum Theatre in NYC
Event.6:
Alex Rodriguez
American baseball player
was born
Event.7: The armistice agreement ending the Korean War was signed at P'anmunjŏm in central Korea.
Event.8: Avant-garde writer Gertrude Stein, whose Paris home was a salon for leading artists and writers, died in Neuilly-sur-Seine, France.
Event.9: Bugs Bunny, Warner Bros. cartoon character created by Tex Avery, Bob Givens (Looney Tunes and Merrie Melodies series), first debuts in "Wild Hare"
Event.10:
Ernest Gary Gygax
American entrepreneur
was born
Event.11: British Field Marshal Bernard Montgomery (39) weds Elizabeth Carver in Chiswick, England
Event.12:
Norman Lear
American producer, writer, and director
was born
Event.13: Frederick Banting and Charles Best isolate insulin at the University of Toronto
Event.14: The Chicago Race Riot of 1919 was ignited after a young black man was stoned and drowned in Lake Michigan for swimming in an area reserved for whites.
Event.15: The world's first military airplane completed one of the final qualifying flights for its sale to the U.S. Army Signal Corps by Wilbur and Orville Wright.
Event.16: Atlantic telegraph cable successfully laid (1,686 miles long)
Event.17: Emperor of Mexico Maximilian I (25) weds princess Charlotte of Belgium (17) in Brussels
Event.18: The July Revolution began in France, leading to the abdication of Charles X and bringing Louis-Philippe to the throne.
Event.19: Antoine-Christophe Merlin and other conspirators initiated the Thermidorian Reaction, a revolt that ultimately resulted in the fall of Maximilien de Robespierre and the end of the Reign of Terror during the French Revolution.
Event.20: US Congress establishes Department of Foreign Affairs now referred to as the State Department
Event.21: Battle of Killicrankie: Jacobite Scottish Highlanders under Viscount Dundee defeat royalist force under General MacKay
Event.22:
Murad IV
Ottoman sultan
was born
Event.23: Sir Walter Raleigh brings first tobacco to England from Virginia
Event.24: Isabella of England marries Enguerrand of Coucy at Windsor
Event.25: At the Battle of Bouvines, French King Philip II defeated an international coalition led by the Holy Roman emperor Otto IV.
